channel.title: SCAR Encrypter Talker
channel.description:
Anyways, here.
I made this last night when I was bored :)
Symbols stay unencrypted, and numbers stay unencrypted. Letters are the only things that get screwed with.
Bring both the encrypted and the decrypter up, run the encrypter first, then the decrypter.
Smartzkid told me in a PM that I should try and make it work on a network or something. I tried using OpenConnection, and while I was screwing around with a packet sniffer I downloaded, I got a port number that I figured was mine. I punched in 127.0.0.1 and the port number both into OpenConnection in SCAR, and it worked! Now if someone could tell me what I could do to get it to send a message to another instance of SCAR on a separate computer, that would be great! I've never really used this line of commands.

item.title: SCAR Encrypter Talker
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

bootnecklad:

io htghst gy dghqk! dghqkleqht lxbl!!!

you said “hi people of mopar! moparscape suxs!!!”

[quote=“1337h4x, post:9, topic:83029”]That is the dirtiest code I’ve seen in my life. Try using rc4, would be much easier and cleaner. You can even skip the utf part, just do the xoring.[/quote] your “utf” means “gen” and “xor” translates to “uid”. though this still does not make sense, that is what it means.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR Encrypter Talker
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

encrypted: iti, foet lekohz, pqlgf2ul. o iqct qf ortq ygk ngxk ftbz gft. gft ziqz tfeknhzl oz kqfrgdsn lg ziqz gfsn zit htklgf vig ror zit tfeknhzogf eqf wkofu wqea viqz oz dtqfz.

decrypted: heh, nice script, jason2gs. i have an idea for your next one. one that encrypts it randomly so that only the person who did the encryption can bring back what it meant.

i made the script encrypt symbols and numbers too:

[code]program New;

var
x: Integer;
TheText, EndText: String;

procedure GetText;
begin
TheText := Readln(‘Please type the text you want encrypted, below.’);
end;

function Encrypt(Text: String):String;
begin
for x := 1 to Length(Text) do
begin
if(Text[x] = ‘’’’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘’’’;
if(Text[x] = ’ ')then
EndText := EndText + ’ ';
if(Text[x] = ‘,’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘!’;
if(Text[x] = ‘.’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘’;
if(Text[x] = ‘?’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘=’;
if(Text[x] = ‘!’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘.’;
if(Text[x] = '’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘)’;
if(Text[x] = ‘=’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘(’;
if(Text[x] = ‘)’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘,’;
if(Text[x] = ‘(’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘?’;
if(Text[x] = ‘a’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘q’;
if(Text[x] = ‘b’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘w’;
if(Text[x] = ‘c’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘e’;
if(Text[x] = ‘d’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘r’;
if(Text[x] = ‘e’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘t’;
if(Text[x] = ‘f’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘y’;
if(Text[x] = ‘g’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘u’;
if(Text[x] = ‘h’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘i’;
if(Text[x] = ‘i’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘o’;
if(Text[x] = ‘j’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘p’;
if(Text[x] = ‘k’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘a’;
if(Text[x] = ‘l’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘s’;
if(Text[x] = ‘m’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘d’;
if(Text[x] = ‘n’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘f’;
if(Text[x] = ‘o’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘g’;
if(Text[x] = ‘p’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘h’;
if(Text[x] = ‘q’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘j’;
if(Text[x] = ‘r’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘k’;
if(Text[x] = ‘s’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘l’;
if(Text[x] = ‘t’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘z’;
if(Text[x] = ‘u’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘x’;
if(Text[x] = ‘v’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘c’;
if(Text[x] = ‘w’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘v’;
if(Text[x] = ‘x’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘b’;
if(Text[x] = ‘y’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘n’;
if(Text[x] = ‘z’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘m’;
if(Text[x] = ‘1’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘9’;
if(Text[x] = ‘2’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘4’;
if(Text[x] = ‘3’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘6’;
if(Text[x] = ‘4’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘8’;
if(Text[x] = ‘5’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘1’;
if(Text[x] = ‘6’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘7’;
if(Text[x] = ‘7’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘5’;
if(Text[x] = ‘8’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘2’;
if(Text[x] = ‘9’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘3’;
end;
Result := EndText;
end;

begin
GetText;
Encrypt(Lowercase(TheText));
Writeln(EndText);
SendInterSCARMessage(‘Encryption’, EndText);
end./code

[code]program New;

var
x: Integer;
TheText, EndText: String;

procedure GetText;
begin
TheText := ReadInterSCARMessage(‘Encryption’);
end;

function Decrypt(TheText: String):String;
begin
for x := 1 to Length(TheText) do
begin
if(TheText[x] = ‘’’’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘’’’;
if(TheText[x] = ’ ')then
EndText := EndText + ’ ';
if(TheText[x] = ‘,’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘)’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘.’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘!’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘?’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘(’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘!’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘,’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘.’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘=’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘?’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘)’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘=’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘(’)then
EndText := EndText + '’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘q’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘a’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘w’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘b’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘e’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘c’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘r’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘d’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘t’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘e’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘y’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘f’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘u’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘g’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘i’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘h’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘o’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘i’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘p’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘j’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘a’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘k’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘s’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘l’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘d’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘m’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘f’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘n’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘g’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘o’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘h’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘p’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘j’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘q’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘k’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘r’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘l’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘s’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘z’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘t’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘x’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘u’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘c’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘v’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘v’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘w’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘b’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘x’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘n’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘y’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘m’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘z’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘1’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘5’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘2’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘8’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘3’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘9’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘4’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘2’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘5’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘7’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘6’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘3’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘7’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘6’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘8’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘4’;
if(TheText[x] = ‘9’)then
EndText := EndText + ‘1’;
end;
Result := EndText;
end;

begin
GetText;
Decrypt(Lowercase(TheText));
Writeln(EndText);
end./code
ecryption after script edit: ga! fgv ziqz zit hxfezxqzogf ol eiqfutr! oz ol tctf iqkrtk ygk htghst zg uxtll oz. viqz voss ngx rg ftbz= o ight oz ol uggr*
decryption after script edit: ok, now that the punctuation is changed, it is even harder for people to guess it! what will you do next? i hope it is good.
number encryption: 123456789(nonencrypted) = 946817523(encrypted)

item.title: SCAR Encrypter Talker
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:5, topic:83029”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=121979.msg1209811#msg1209811 date=1177433402]
Also, you can run through an array.

TextArrayOne[1] := ‘abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz’;
for i := 1 to Length(TextArrayOne[1]) do
begin
Replace(pos(string, 1, 0){current string we’re replacing}, StrGet(TextArrayOne, 1));
end;

Rough example, can’t test. I’ll reply to this when I’m at home.
[/quote]
I think i know what you’re talking about. Here’s what i’d do, jason:

This is based of your Encryption method… The alphabet letter + 1:

function Encode(s, Alphabet: String): String;
var i, p: Integer;
begin
  for i:= 1 to Length(s) do
  begin
    p:= pos(Copy(lowercase(s), i, 1), Alphabet) + 1;
    if (p-1 = 0) then
    begin
       Result := Result + Copy(lowercase(s), i, 1);
    end else
    begin
      Result := Result + Copy(Alphabet, p, 1);
    end;
  end;
end;

function Decode(s, Alphabet: String): String;
var i, p: Integer;
begin
  for i:= 1 to Length(s) do
  begin
    p:= pos(Copy(lowercase(s), i, 1), Alphabet);
    if (p = 0) then
    begin
      Result:= Result + Copy(lowercase(s), i, 1);
    end else
    begin
      Result:= Result + Copy(Alphabet, p-1, 1);
    end;
  end;
end;

var Alphabet, s: String;
begin
  Alphabet:= 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz 1234567890';
  s:= 'Kane rules you all, like, totally! lol..';
  ClearDebug;
  Writeln('Encoded: ' + Encode(s, Alphabet));
  Writeln('Decoded: ' + Decode(Encode(s, Alphabet), Alphabet));
end.

Basically, based on the Alphabet, it finds each letter in the requested encrypted string and if it’s found in the alphabet it’s added on to the result string as the next letter… If it’s not found it’s just itself.

The above script will write in the debug:

Encoded: lbof1svmft1zpv1bmm,1mjlf,1upubmmz!1mpm..
Decoded: kane rules you all, like, totally! lol..
Successfully executed

If the two Alphabets don’t match when encoding and decoding it won’t work.
Reading other peoples scripts, observing and testing is the best way to learn imo.[/quote]

That’s it, yes, I was at school and couldn’t test.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR Encrypter Talker
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:4, topic:83029”]Also, you can run through an array.

TextArrayOne[1] := ‘abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz’;
for i := 1 to Length(TextArrayOne[1]) do
begin
Replace(pos(string, 1, 0){current string we’re replacing}, StrGet(TextArrayOne, 1));
end;

Rough example, can’t test. I’ll reply to this when I’m at home.[/quote]
I think i know what you’re talking about. Here’s what i’d do, jason:

This is based of your Encryption method… The alphabet letter + 1:

function Encode(s, Alphabet: String): String;
var i, p: Integer;
begin
  for i:= 1 to Length(s) do
  begin
    p:= pos(Copy(lowercase(s), i, 1), Alphabet) + 1;
    if (p-1 = 0) then
    begin
       Result := Result + Copy(lowercase(s), i, 1);
    end else
    begin
      Result := Result + Copy(Alphabet, p, 1);
    end;
  end;
end;

function Decode(s, Alphabet: String): String;
var i, p: Integer;
begin
  for i:= 1 to Length(s) do
  begin
    p:= pos(Copy(lowercase(s), i, 1), Alphabet);
    if (p = 0) then
    begin
      Result:= Result + Copy(lowercase(s), i, 1);
    end else
    begin
      Result:= Result + Copy(Alphabet, p-1, 1);
    end;
  end;
end;

var Alphabet, s: String;
begin
  Alphabet:= 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz 1234567890';
  s:= 'Kane rules you all, like, totally! lol..';
  ClearDebug;
  Writeln('Encoded: ' + Encode(s, Alphabet));
  Writeln('Decoded: ' + Decode(Encode(s, Alphabet), Alphabet));
end.

Basically, based on the Alphabet, it finds each letter in the requested encrypted string and if it’s found in the alphabet it’s added on to the result string as the next letter… If it’s not found it’s just itself.

The above script will write in the debug:

Encoded: lbof1svmft1zpv1bmm,1mjlf,1upubmmz!1mpm..
Decoded: kane rules you all, like, totally! lol..
Successfully executed

If the two Alphabets don’t match when encoding and decoding it won’t work.
Reading other peoples scripts, observing and testing is the best way to learn imo.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR Encrypter Talker
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Not a very hard Encrypter, but a good start.

Let me just suggest using case’s though, instead of all those if’s:
Example.

Instead of

     if(Text[x] = '''')then
     EndText := EndText + '''';
     if(Text[x] = ' ')then
     EndText := EndText + ' ';
     if(Text[x] = ',')then
     EndText := EndText + ',';
     if(Text[x] = '.')then
     EndText := EndText + '.';
     if(Text[x] = '?')then
     EndText := EndText + '?';
     if(Text[x] = '!')then
     EndText := EndText + '!';
     if(Text[x] = '*')then
     EndText := EndText + '*';
     if(Text[x] = '=')then
     EndText := EndText + '=';
     if(Text[x] = ')')then
     EndText := EndText + ')';
     if(Text[x] = '(')then
     EndText := EndText + '(';
     if(Text[x] = 'a')then
     EndText := EndText + 'q';
     if(Text[x] = 'b')then
     EndText := EndText + 'w';
     if(Text[x] = 'c')then
     EndText := EndText + 'e';
     if(Text[x] = 'd')then
     EndText := EndText + 'r';
     if(Text[x] = 'e')then
     EndText := EndText + 't';
     if(Text[x] = 'f')then
     EndText := EndText + 'y';
     if(Text[x] = 'g')then
     EndText := EndText + 'u';
     if(Text[x] = 'h')then
     EndText := EndText + 'i';
     if(Text[x] = 'i')then
     EndText := EndText + 'o';
     if(Text[x] = 'j')then
     EndText := EndText + 'p';
     if(Text[x] = 'k')then
     EndText := EndText + 'a';
     if(Text[x] = 'l')then
     EndText := EndText + 's';
     if(Text[x] = 'm')then
     EndText := EndText + 'd';
     if(Text[x] = 'n')then
     EndText := EndText + 'f';
     if(Text[x] = 'o')then
     EndText := EndText + 'g';
     if(Text[x] = 'p')then
     EndText := EndText + 'h';
     if(Text[x] = 'q')then
     EndText := EndText + 'j';
     if(Text[x] = 'r')then
     EndText := EndText + 'k';
     if(Text[x] = 's')then
     EndText := EndText + 'l';
     if(Text[x] = 't')then
     EndText := EndText + 'z';
     if(Text[x] = 'u')then
     EndText := EndText + 'x';
     if(Text[x] = 'v')then
     EndText := EndText + 'c';
     if(Text[x] = 'w')then
     EndText := EndText + 'v';
     if(Text[x] = 'x')then
     EndText := EndText + 'b';
     if(Text[x] = 'y')then
     EndText := EndText + 'n';
     if(Text[x] = 'z')then
     EndText := EndText + 'm';
     if(Text[x] = '1')then
     EndText := EndText + '1';
     if(Text[x] = '2')then
     EndText := EndText + '2';
     if(Text[x] = '3')then
     EndText := EndText + '3';
     if(Text[x] = '4')then
     EndText := EndText + '4';
     if(Text[x] = '5')then
     EndText := EndText + '5';
     if(Text[x] = '6')then
     EndText := EndText + '6';
     if(Text[x] = '7')then
     EndText := EndText + '7';
     if(Text[x] = '8')then
     EndText := EndText + '8';
     if(Text[x] = '9')then
     EndText := EndText + '9';

You could just have:

case Text[x] of
  '''': EndText:= '''';
  ' ': EndText:= ' ';
  ',' : EndText:= ',';
end;

ect.

And instead of a procedure for getting the text, just put it at the start:

begin
TheText := Readln('Please type the text you want encrypted, below.');
Encrypt(Lowercase(TheText));
Writeln(EndText);
SendInterSCARMessage('Encryption', EndText);
end.

Read full topic
